frontMatter.title: Help
frontMatter.description: Find resources to help you build with Mapbox.

frontMatter.title: Access tokens
frontMatter.description: Learn how access tokens work and how to create and manage your access tokens.

frontMatter.title: Create new data
frontMatter.description: Learn how datasets work and how to create geospatial data from scratch using Mapbox.

frontMatter.title: Spatial analysis
frontMatter.description: Learn how spatial analysis with Turf works and how to use Turf in your web application.

frontMatter.title: Satellite imagery
frontMatter.description: Learn how satellite imagery works and how to use it in your next Mapbox project.

frontMatter.title: Static and print maps
frontMatter.description: Learn how the Mapbox Static Images API works and how to create static maps.

frontMatter.title: Upload data
frontMatter.description: Learn the difference between tilesets and datasets, how the upload process works, and techniques for uploading.

frontMatter.title: Unity applications
frontMatter.description: Learn how the Mapbox Maps SDK for Unity works, how to use it, and how to get started building applications.

frontMatter.title: access token
frontMatter.description: Mapbox uses access tokens to associate your account with your requests to Mapbox API resources.

frontMatter.title: annotation
frontMatter.description: An annotation is a defined location on a map in the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS.

frontMatter.title: attribution
frontMatter.description: Attribution is the combination of two visual elements that are placed on all Mapbox maps, stating that a map was created with Mapbox tools and data.

frontMatter.title: baselayer
frontMatter.description: A baselayer was a map style designed in Mapbox Studio Classic. Mapbox Studio, the modern alternative to Mapbox Studio Classic, does not use baselayers.

frontMatter.title: bearing
frontMatter.description: Bearing is the direction you're facing, as measured from a compass.

frontMatter.title: bounding box
frontMatter.description: A bounding box is a mechanism for describing a particular area of a map.

frontMatter.title: camera
frontMatter.description: In maps that use Mapbox GL, the camera is a map's field of view.

frontMatter.title: CartoCSS
frontMatter.description: CartoCSS was a language used by Mapbox Studio Classic to build classic styles. Mapbox Studio, the modern alternative to Mapbox Studio Classic, does not use CartoCSS.

frontMatter.title: classic style
frontMatter.description: A classic style was a map style made with Mapbox Studio Classic. Mapbox Studio, the modern alternative to Mapbox Studio Classic, does not use classic styles.

frontMatter.title: CSV
frontMatter.description: The CSV (comma-separated values) format can be used for mapping if the file contains geographic information.

frontMatter.title: data-driven styling
frontMatter.description: Data-driven styling allows you to style spatial data based on its properties.

frontMatter.title: dataset ID
frontMatter.description: Use the dataset ID to make requests related to the dataset using the Datasets API.

frontMatter.title: dataset
frontMatter.description: A dataset is an editable collection of GeoJSON features.

frontMatter.title: Datasets API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Datasets API allows you to read, create, update, and remove datasets and dataset features.

frontMatter.title: Directions API
frontMatter.description: With the Mapbox Directions API, you can add routing with turn-by-turn directions to your map.

frontMatter.title: expression
frontMatter.description: An expression defines a formula for computing the value of any layout property, paint property, or filter within a map style.

frontMatter.title: feature querying
frontMatter.description: Feature querying is the process by which features in a tileset are identified at a specific location.

frontMatter.title: feature
frontMatter.description: A geospatial feature refers to an individual point, line, or polygon in a dataset or in a tileset.

frontMatter.title: filter
frontMatter.description: A filter, also known as a predicate within iOS and macOS, gives you fine-grained control over the content of a style layer.

frontMatter.title: font stack
frontMatter.description: A font stack is a collection of fonts that belong to an individual layer within a style.

frontMatter.title: Geocoding API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Geocoding API performs two main tasks, forward geocoding and reverse geocoding.

frontMatter.title: geocoding
frontMatter.description: Geocoding is the process of taking an address or name of a place and converting it into latitude and longitude values.

frontMatter.title: GeoJSON
frontMatter.description: GeoJSON is a file format for representing map data. Mapbox web services and APIs serve geospatial data as GeoJSON.

frontMatter.title: GPX
frontMatter.description: GPX (GPS eXchange format) is a data format commonly created from GPS receivers.

frontMatter.title: iframe
frontMatter.description: An iframe is an HTML element that allows you to embed a map into a website.

frontMatter.title: Glossary
frontMatter.description: Find Mapbox-related terms and their definitions.
frontMatter.cardDescription: Find Mapbox-related terms and their definitions.

frontMatter.title: Isochrone API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Isochrone API allows you to request polygon or line features that show areas that are reachable within a specified amount of time from a location.

frontMatter.title: KML
frontMatter.description: KML is a geospatial file format that’s commonly used in Google products.

frontMatter.title: latitude and longitude
frontMatter.description: Latitude and longitude are a pair of numbers (coordinates) used to describe a position on the plane of a geographic coordinate system.

frontMatter.title: style layer
frontMatter.description: A style layer is used to add styling rules to a specific subset of data in a map style.

frontMatter.title: Leaflet
frontMatter.description: Leaflet is an open-source web mapping library that forms the basis of Mapbox.js.

frontMatter.title: layout and paint properties
frontMatter.description: Layout and paint properties are two sub-properties of a layer that decides how data from the layer is rendered in maps that use Mapbox GL.

frontMatter.title: Maki icon set
frontMatter.description: The Maki icon set is used in map styles. It includes common point of interest icons.

frontMatter.title: map ID
frontMatter.description: Map ID is a deprecated term for the unique identifier used to identify a tileset. This identifier is now called a tileset ID.

frontMatter.title: map loads
frontMatter.description: A map load occurs whenever a Mapbox GL JS `Map` object is initialized on a webpage. It is used to track map usage on the web.

frontMatter.title: Map Matching API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Map Matching API allows you to take recorded traces, such as the data from a GPS tracker, and snap them to the OpenStreetMap road and path network.

frontMatter.title: map view
frontMatter.description: Map views were formerly used as a unit of measurement to track map usage on the web. Map views are now deprecated.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Maps SDK for Android
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Maps SDK for Android is an open-source toolset for building mapping applications for Android devices.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox components for Framer X
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox components for Framer X can be used to add interactive maps to Framer prototypes.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Editor
frontMatter.description: Mapbox Editor was an online interface for designing maps that has been deprecated. Mapbox Studio is the modern alternative to Mapbox Editor.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Mapbox GL JS is a JavaScript library that uses Mapbox GL to render interactive maps.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox GL
frontMatter.description: Mapbox GL is a suite of open-source libraries for embedding customizable and responsive client-side maps in web, mobile, and desktop applications.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS is an open-source toolset for building mapping applications for iPhone and iPad devices.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox.js
frontMatter.description: Mapbox.js is no longer in active development. Mapbox.js is a JavaScript library that allows you to add a map to your website.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Maps SDK for Unity
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Maps SDK for Unity is an open-source toolset for building location-based augmented and virtual reality applications with Unity, using real map data.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Navigation SDKs
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Navigation SDKs for iOS and Android provide open-source toolsets for integrating turn-by-turn navigation within mobile applications.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Satellite
frontMatter.description: Mapbox Satellite is a global tileset of high-resolution satellite imagery.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Studio Classic
frontMatter.description: Mapbox Studio Classic was a desktop application for designing classic styles. Mapbox Studio is the modern alternative to Mapbox Studio Classic.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Studio
frontMatter.description: Mapbox Studio is a web application for creating map styles and managing your datasets and tilesets.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Tiling Service (MTS)
frontMatter.description: Mapbox Tiling Service (MTS) allows you to list, delete, and retrieve TileJSON metadata for raster and vector tilesets.

frontMatter.title: Mapnik
frontMatter.description: Mapnik is an open-source toolkit for developing mapping applications.

frontMatter.title: Maps SDK for React Native
frontMatter.description: The Maps SDK for React Native is a community-managed React Native library for integrating Mapbox maps into mobile apps.

frontMatter.title: marker
frontMatter.description: A marker is a visual representation of a specific coordinate on a map.

frontMatter.title: Mapbox Matrix API elements
frontMatter.description: Elements are the source and destination coordinate pairs used in a Mapbox Matrix API request.

frontMatter.title: Matrix API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Matrix API calculates travel times between many points in one API request.

frontMatter.title: MBTiles
frontMatter.description: MBTiles is a file format for storing tilesets.

frontMatter.title: monthly active users
frontMatter.description: Monthly active users (MAU) is the number of users who accessed Mapbox services within your applications during a given month.

frontMatter.title: OpenStreetMap
frontMatter.description: OpenStreetMap is a collaborative mapping project that creates a world map.

frontMatter.title: offline regions and offline packs
frontMatter.description: An offline region is a defined region of a map that is available for use in conditions with limited or no network connection.

frontMatter.title: Optimization API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Optimization API returns a duration-optimized route between provided input coordinates.

frontMatter.title: overzoom
frontMatter.description: Overzoom is the result of a tileset being zoomed in beyond its given zoom extent.

frontMatter.title: point
frontMatter.description: A point is a geospatial feature defined by one pair of latitude and longitude coordinates.

frontMatter.title: projection
frontMatter.description: Projections are methods of transforming the coordinates of locations on the planet to a two-dimensional plane.

frontMatter.title: quadtree
frontMatter.description: Map tiles are stored in a quadtree data structure.

frontMatter.title: Raster Tiles API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Raster Tiles API allows you to request a single tile from a Mapbox-hosted raster tileset.

frontMatter.title: raster data
frontMatter.description: Raster data is a pixel-based data format used in raster tilesets.

frontMatter.title: routing profile
frontMatter.description: A routing profile is a set of rules that a routing engine uses to find the optimal route between two points.

frontMatter.title: shapefile
frontMatter.description: A shapefile is a file format for storing geographic vector data.

frontMatter.title: runtime styling
frontMatter.description: Runtime styling allows you to dynamically change the map style displayed on your Mapbox map in real time.

frontMatter.title: simplestyle
frontMatter.description: Simplestyle is an open source specification for styling GeoJSON data used in Mapbox.js and in GeoJSON overlays in the Static Images API.

frontMatter.title: SKU tokens
frontMatter.description: SKU tokens are used by some SDKs for tracking usage.

frontMatter.title: source layer
frontMatter.description: A source layer is an individual layer of data within a source.

frontMatter.title: source
frontMatter.description: A source supplies the data that Mapbox GL displays on a map.

frontMatter.title: sprite
frontMatter.description: A sprite is a single image that contains all the icons included in a style.

frontMatter.title: Static Tiles API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Static Tiles API serves raster tiles generated from a Mapbox GL style.

frontMatter.title: Static Images API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Static Images API allows you to request a standalone, static image of a map generated from a Mapbox GL-based style.

frontMatter.title: style component
frontMatter.description: A style component is a collection of related map features that you style as a single unit in the Mapbox Studio style editor. Each component can contain one or more layers.

frontMatter.title: style ID
frontMatter.description: A style ID is a map style's unique identifier.

frontMatter.title: style-optimized vector tiles
frontMatter.description: Style-optimized vector tiles remove any layers or features in a tile that are not represented by a given Mapbox style.

frontMatter.title: style URL
frontMatter.description: A style URL allows you to reference a style created with Mapbox Studio.

frontMatter.title: style
frontMatter.description: A style is a JSON document that defines the visual appearance of a map.

frontMatter.title: Styles API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Styles API allows you to programmatically read and write map styles, fonts, and sprites.

frontMatter.title: SVG
frontMatter.description: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is a markup language for describing two-dimensional vector graphics.

frontMatter.title: symbol layer
frontMatter.description: A symbol layer is a layer in which icons or text are added to a Mapbox map.

frontMatter.title: telemetry
frontMatter.description: Telemetry is a process in which automatic sensors create and update maps by gathering anonymized data about where and how people are moving.

frontMatter.title: TIFF
frontMatter.description: TIFF is a file format for saving raster images.

frontMatter.title: TileJSON
frontMatter.description: TileJSON is a format for describing tilesets.

frontMatter.title: TileMill
frontMatter.description: TileMill was a desktop application for designing maps that has been deprecated. Mapbox Studio is the modern alternative to TileMill.

frontMatter.title: Tilequery API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Tilequery API allows you to retrieve data about specific features from a vector tileset, based on a given latitude and longitude.

frontMatter.title: tileset ID
frontMatter.description: Tileset IDs, previously known as Map IDs, are used to identify vector and raster tilesets.

frontMatter.title: tileset recipe
frontMatter.description: This feature is in beta. Tileset recipes describe how tileset source data should look and behave when a tileset is published by Mapbox Tiling Service (MTS).

frontMatter.title: tileset source
frontMatter.description: This feature is in beta. Tileset sources are line-delimited GeoJSON sources used to create new tilesets using Mapbox Tiling Service (MTS).

frontMatter.title: tileset
frontMatter.description: A tileset is a collection of raster or vector data broken up into a uniform grid of square tiles at 22 preset zoom levels.

frontMatter.title: Tokens API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Tokens API allows you to create, edit, and delete access tokens.

frontMatter.title: Turf.js
frontMatter.description: Turf.js is an open-source JavaScript library used for spatial analysis.

frontMatter.title: Uploads API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Uploads API transforms geographic data into tilesets that can be used with maps and geographic applications.

frontMatter.title: Vector Tiles API
frontMatter.description: The Mapbox Vector Tiles API allows you to request a single tile from a Mapbox-hosted vector tileset.

frontMatter.title: vector tiles
frontMatter.description: A vector tile is a lightweight data format for storing geospatial vector data, such as points, lines, and polygons.

frontMatter.title: WordPress map block
frontMatter.description: The WordPress map block allows WordPress users to add a Mapbox map to any post or page.

frontMatter.title: worldview
frontMatter.description: In Mapbox vector tilesets, the "worldview" data field is used to identify geographic features whose characteristics are defined differently by various groups.

frontMatter.title: zoom extent
frontMatter.description: The zoom extent is the range of zoom levels at which a tileset is visible.

frontMatter.title: Access elevation data
frontMatter.description: Learn how to access elevation data in Mapbox tilesets.

frontMatter.title: How to regain access to your account
frontMatter.description: Learn to troubleshoot common account lockout scenarios.

frontMatter.title: Address geocoding format guide
frontMatter.description: Follow these best practices when formatting addresses for geocoding.

frontMatter.title: Adjust the zoom extent of your tileset
frontMatter.description: Learn how to manually adjust the zoom extent of your tilesets.

frontMatter.title: Understanding Android APK size
frontMatter.description: Learn how to measure and optimize your Android app’s size.

frontMatter.title: Blank or missing map tiles
frontMatter.description: Learn why you may be seeing blank or missing tiles.

frontMatter.title: Change your map’s label language
frontMatter.description: Learn about available languages and how to change your map’s language.

frontMatter.title: CORS errors
frontMatter.description: Learn how to address CORS errors.

frontMatter.title: Working with firewalls
frontMatter.description: General troubleshooting tips and some configuration guidance for working with Mapbox behind a firewall.

frontMatter.title: CSV file errors
frontMatter.description: Learn how to fix errors when uploading CSV files.

frontMatter.title: Troubleshooting
frontMatter.description: Resolve common issues across Mapbox products.
frontMatter.cardDescription: Resolve common issues across Mapbox products.

frontMatter.title: Integrate the Mapbox Visual with Microsoft Power BI
frontMatter.description: General configuration guidance and tips for using the Mapbox Visual in Microsoft Power BI.
products: Mapbox Visual for Microsoft Power BI

frontMatter.title: Understanding iOS framework size
frontMatter.description: Learn how to measure and optimize your iOS app’s size.

frontMatter.title: Troubleshooting Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS installation
frontMatter.description: Learn how to troubleshoot frequently seen issues when installing the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS.

frontMatter.title: Manage large data files for Mapbox Studio with Tippecanoe
frontMatter.description: Learn how to manage big data files and make a scale-independent view of your data.

frontMatter.title: Troubleshooting App Store submission with the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: Learn how to troubleshoot frequently seen issues when submitting applications built with the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS to the App Store.

frontMatter.title: Manage your fontstacks
frontMatter.description: Learn how to manage fontstacks for optimal rendering.

frontMatter.title: Browser support
frontMatter.description: Learn which browsers support each Mapbox product.

frontMatter.title: Migrating to the modern Static Images API
frontMatter.description: Tools and tips for updating to the modern Static Images API.

frontMatter.title: Optimize map label placement
frontMatter.description: Optimize label placement on web and mobile maps.

frontMatter.title: Get your PostGIS data ready for Mapbox Studio
frontMatter.description: Methods to re-format, query, and export PostGIS data into a Mapbox Studio ready format.

frontMatter.title: Keep access tokens private in open source iOS and Android apps
frontMatter.description: Learn how to protect your access tokens so that they aren't used by others.

frontMatter.title: Troubleshoot raster image with black background
frontMatter.description: Learn how to fix raster images that display black backgrounds.

frontMatter.title: Source limits in Mapbox Studio styles
frontMatter.description: Read about strategies for reducing the number of tileset sources in Mapbox Studio styles.

frontMatter.title: Report a problem with the map
frontMatter.description: Learn how to report errors on Mapbox maps.

frontMatter.title: Troubleshooting SVG image errors in Mapbox Studio
frontMatter.description: Learn how to fix SVG upload errors in Mapbox Studio.

frontMatter.title: Transfer styles between accounts
frontMatter.description: Learn how to transfer Mapbox styles between accounts.

frontMatter.title: Use custom Mapbox styles in Tableau
frontMatter.description: General configuration guidance and tips for using custom Mapbox maps in Tableau.

frontMatter.title: Video: Add a gradient route line to a map
frontMatter.description: Use a helper library add a multi-colored line to a static map image.

frontMatter.title: Add points to a web map, part 2: create a style
frontMatter.description: Add a tileset to a template style and upload custom icons in Mapbox Studio.

frontMatter.title: Add points to a web map, part 1: create a dataset
frontMatter.description: Create a new dataset containing points.

frontMatter.title: Add points to a web map, part 3: add interactivity
frontMatter.description: Add popups when markers are clicked using Mapbox GL JS.

frontMatter.title: Add a Mapbox Studio style as a basemap in ArcGIS Online
frontMatter.description: Add your map as a basemap to ArcGIS Online.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with and access to ArcGIS Online.

frontMatter.title: Add a Mapbox style to a CARTO map
frontMatter.description: Add your map as a basemap to CARTO.

frontMatter.title: Create a map in Unity
frontMatter.description: Use the Mapbox Maps SDK for Unity to create a visualization of 3D buildings on top of a 3D terrain map for use in a Unity application.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Unity.

frontMatter.title: Customize label text for a single label
frontMatter.description: Use expressions in Mapbox Studio to alter a single label.

frontMatter.title: Video: Customize or hide text for a single label
frontMatter.description: Change or hide a label by applying a data condition or filter.

frontMatter.title: Georeference imagery
frontMatter.description: Take your non-georeferenced aerial image or historical map and get it onto a Mapbox map with the help of QGIS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with QGIS.

frontMatter.title: Creating access tokens with the Tokens API
frontMatter.description: Walk through creating permanent and temporary access tokens using the Tokens API.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with APIs and using the command line.

frontMatter.title: Switch from Google Maps to Mapbox
frontMatter.description: Are you using the Google Maps API? This guide walks you through how to convert a Google web map to a Mapbox web map using Mapbox GL JS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Tutorials
frontMatter.description: Find a step-by-step guide to help you get started or take your project to the next level.
frontMatter.cardDescription: Find a step-by-step guide to help you get started or take your project to the next level.

frontMatter.title: Build indoor floorplans with Mapbox
frontMatter.description: Upload a floorplan to create an indoor map.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with GIS.

frontMatter.title: Add Mapbox maps as layers in ArcGIS and QGIS with WMTS
frontMatter.description: Learn how to add Mapbox maps as layers in ArcGIS and QGIS with WMTS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with and access to ArcGIS.

frontMatter.title: Use Mapbox with OpenLayers
frontMatter.description: Learn how to use Mapbox with OpenLayers.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Add markers to a map
frontMatter.description: There are many ways to add markers to the map. This guide will help you identify the best method for your use case.

frontMatter.title: Point-in-polygon query with Mapbox Boundaries
frontMatter.description: Query data in v2 of the Mapbox Boundaries tileset.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development and access to Mapbox Boundaries.

frontMatter.title: Add OpenStreetMap data to your Mapbox project
frontMatter.description: Learn how to export OpenStreetMap data to be used in your Mapbox project.
frontMatter.prereq: Learn to navigate the OpenStreetMap tagging system.

frontMatter.title: Style a single country
frontMatter.description: Find and upload open source data to style in Mapbox Studio.

frontMatter.title: Custom map styles in Unity
frontMatter.description: Use a custom map style from Mapbox Studio in a Unity application.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Unity.

frontMatter.title: Upload to Mapbox using cURL
frontMatter.description: Learn how to use the Mapbox Uploads API.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with cURL.

frontMatter.title: Video: Recreate a classic style in modern Mapbox Studio
frontMatter.description: Follow these steps to modernize your favorite Mapbox Studio Classic style.

frontMatter.title: Geocoding
frontMatter.description: Learn how geocoding works and how to use geocoding in your next Mapbox project.

frontMatter.title: How Mapbox Works
frontMatter.description: Learn about the building blocks that Mapbox provides so you can create custom mapping applications.
frontMatter.cardDescription: Learn how the Mapbox platform works.

frontMatter.title: Map design
frontMatter.description: Learn how Mapbox styles work and where you can go to learn more and get started designing your map.

frontMatter.title: Mobile applications
frontMatter.description: Learn how the Mapbox mobile SDKs work and how to add Mapbox maps to a mobile application.

frontMatter.title: Our map data
frontMatter.description: Learn about Mapbox’s map data, where it comes from, and how you can leverage it in your next project.

frontMatter.title: Web applications
frontMatter.description: Learn how Mapbox’s JavaScript libraries work and how to integrate them into your web applications.

frontMatter.title: zoom level
frontMatter.description: A zoom level determines how much of a map is visible.

frontMatter.title: Collaboration best practices
frontMatter.description: Learn best practices for setting up an account and collaborating on projects.

frontMatter.title: How to use Mapbox securely
frontMatter.description: Learn how to use Mapbox securely.

frontMatter.title: How to get support while building with Mapbox
frontMatter.description: Learn about all the different options for support while you are building location applications with Mapbox.

frontMatter.title: Manage your tileset processing and tileset hosting costs
frontMatter.description: Follow these practices to optimize your tileset processing and tileset hosting costs when you tile data using Mapbox Tiling Service (MTS) or the Mapbox Uploads API.

frontMatter.title: Migrating to the modern Static Tiles API
frontMatter.description: Update your Leaflet.js or Mapbox.js implementation to use the modern Mapbox Static Tiles API.

frontMatter.title: Offline maps
frontMatter.description: Learn about how offline maps work.

frontMatter.title: Transition from Mapbox.js to Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Learn about transitioning from using Mapbox.js to using Mapbox GL JS in your apps.

frontMatter.title: Using recolorable images in Mapbox maps
frontMatter.description: Learn how Mapbox uses recolorable images in maps including SDF-enabled images and iOS's template rendering mode.

frontMatter.title: Add 3D buildings to a Mapbox Studio style
frontMatter.description: Add a 3D building layer to a map style in Mapbox Studio.

frontMatter.title: Working with large GeoJSON sources in Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Strategies for handling large GeoJSON sources with GL JS.

frontMatter.title: Analyze data with Turf.js and Mapbox.js
frontMatter.description: Using Turf.js, you can add some spatial analysis to your map to solve problems. This guide walks through an example of Turf.js and Mapbox.js in a real-world context.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Data-driven styling for Android
frontMatter.description: Create a map for Android that styles a circle based on a data attribute.
frontMatter.prereq: An Android application with a map view set up and familiarity with Android Studio and Java.

frontMatter.title: Tracking device location for Android
frontMatter.description: Display a Mapbox map on an Android device and receive updates on the device's current location.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Android Studio and Java.

frontMatter.title: Runtime styling for Android
frontMatter.description: Change various properties of a map based on user interaction and other "runtime" situations.
frontMatter.prereq: An Android application with a map view set up and familiarity with Android Studio and Java.

frontMatter.title: AR customization using Mapbox Vision SDK for Android
frontMatter.description: Use the Mapbox Vision SDK for Android to add AR navigation to an application and customize some visual elements.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Java / Kotlin.

frontMatter.title: Custom detections using Mapbox Vision SDK for Android
frontMatter.description: Draw custom detections using device built-in camera.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Android Studio and Java / Kotlin.

frontMatter.title: Build a store locator using Mapbox.js
frontMatter.description: Build a map application with Mapbox.js. This guide walks you through all the code that you need to build a store locator.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts. Some advanced JavaScript required.

frontMatter.title: Create a custom style
frontMatter.description: Alter a template style to create a custom map style.

frontMatter.title: Make a choropleth map, part 1: create a style
frontMatter.description: Upload custom data to Mapbox Studio, add it to a template style, and use filters to style your data.

frontMatter.title: Make a choropleth map, part 2: add interactivity
frontMatter.description: Publish your style with Mapbox GL JS, create a legend, and add interactive elements.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Create a timezone finder with Mapbox Tilequery API
frontMatter.description: Create a timezone finder app with Mapbox Tilequery API.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts including JavaScript and API calls.

frontMatter.title: Add custom markers in Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Add custom HTML markers, style them, and add tooltips with Mapbox GL JS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Extend Mapbox Boundaries
frontMatter.description: Extend the Mapbox Boundaries tileset.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development, command line tools, and GIS. Access to Mapbox Boundaries.

frontMatter.title: Extend with Mapbox.js
frontMatter.description: Meet Mapbox.js - the toolset for creating interactions and greater customization of your map and data.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: First steps with the Mapbox Maps SDK for Android
frontMatter.description: Walk through installing the Mapbox Maps SDK for Android, getting a map on the screen, and changing the map style.
frontMatter.prereq: Completion of the [Mapbox Maps SDK for Android installation process](https://docs.mapbox.com/android/maps/overview/#install-the-maps-sdk) and familiarity with Android Studio and Java.

frontMatter.title: First steps with the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: Walk through installing the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS, getting a map on the screen, and placing a pin on it.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode and either Swift or Objective-C, and completion of the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS installation guide.

frontMatter.title: Get started with Mapbox Boundaries v1
frontMatter.description: Get started with v1 of the Mapbox Boundaries tileset.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development and access to Mapbox Boundaries.

frontMatter.title: Get started with Mapbox Boundaries v2
frontMatter.description: Get started with v2 of the Mapbox Boundaries tileset.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development and access to Mapbox Boundaries.

frontMatter.title: Get started with Mapbox Boundaries
frontMatter.description: Get started with v3 of the Mapbox Boundaries tileset.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development and access to Mapbox Boundaries.

frontMatter.title: Get started using Mapbox Tiling Service and the Tilesets CLI
frontMatter.description: This feature is in beta. Learn how to use the Tilesets CLI, a tool for accessing Mapbox Tiling Service (MTS), to create new Mapbox tilesets.
frontMatter.prereq: Successful installation of the Tilesets CLI

frontMatter.title: Improve perceived performance of Mapbox GL JS using the Static Images API
frontMatter.description: Use the Static Images API to create an instant image of your map while Mapbox GL JS loads in the background.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts including JavaScript and API calls.

frontMatter.title: Get started with expressions using the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: Create a map for iOS that styles a circle based on a data attribute.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode and either Swift or Objective-C, and completion of the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS installation guide.

frontMatter.title: Create a map view compatible with SwiftUI
frontMatter.description: Learn how to use the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS with SwiftUI to create a map view, add an annotation, and add a fill layer to the map.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode 11 and Swift, and completion of the Mapbox Maps SDK for iOS installation guide.

frontMatter.title: AR customization using Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: Use the Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS to add AR navigation to an application and customize some visual elements.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode and Swift, and completion of the Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS [Install and configure guide](https://docs.mapbox.com/ios/vision/overview/install-and-configure/).

frontMatter.title: Draw points of interest using the Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: Use coordinate transformations to draw a point of interest (POI) on the screen from its geolocation using the Vision SDK for iOS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode and Swift, and completion of the Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS `Install and configure` guide.

frontMatter.title: Draw safety alerts using the Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS
frontMatter.description: Use Vision Safety module to read the situation on the road and create custom safety alerts.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode and Swift, and completion of the Mapbox Vision SDK for iOS `Install and configure` guide.

frontMatter.title: Make a heatmap with Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Add custom HTML markers, style them, and add tooltips with Mapbox GL JS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Get started with Mapbox GL JS expressions
frontMatter.description: Learn how to write expressions in Mapbox GL JS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Make a choropleth map with the Mapbox Visual for Power BI
frontMatter.description: Create a choropleth data map with the Mapbox Visual for Microsoft Power BI.
products: Mapbox Visual for Microsoft Power BI
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI.

frontMatter.title: Create data visualizations with the Mapbox Visual for Power BI
frontMatter.description: Use Microsoft Power BI to create a custom data visualization.
products: Mapbox Visual for Microsoft Power BI
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI.

frontMatter.title: Using style parameters with the Static Images API
frontMatter.description: This tutorial demonstrates how you can apply custom styles to a Static Image by including style parameters in the API request.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Make a heatmap with Mapbox Studio
frontMatter.description: Learn how to add and configure a heatmap layer using Mapbox Studio.

frontMatter.title: Use Mapbox.js as a fallback
frontMatter.description: Create a web app that uses Mapbox.js and the Static Tiles API when WebGL is not supported.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Directions
frontMatter.description: Learn how Mapbox’s directions services work and how to add directions services to applications across platforms.

frontMatter.title: Improve the performance of Mapbox GL JS maps
frontMatter.description: Learn how to improve the performance of your Mapbox GL JS maps.

frontMatter.title: Migrate from Mapbox Streets v7 to v8
frontMatter.description: Tips for upgrading to the latest Mapbox base map tileset.

frontMatter.title: Upload data to Mapbox
frontMatter.description: Learn how to prepare data for upload, interpret error messages, and troubleshoot failed uploads.

frontMatter.title: Analyze data with Turf.js and Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Using Turf.js, add spatial analysis to our map to solve problems. This guide walks through an example of Turf.js and Mapbox GL JS in a real-world context.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Build one set of code for China and global map styles
frontMatter.description: Determine whether the device is in China and then load a corresponding map style.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Android Studio and Java and completion of the [Tracking device location for Android](/help/tutorials/android-location-listening/) tutorial.

frontMatter.title: Build a navigation app for Android
frontMatter.description: Integrate navigation into any Android application.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Android Studio and Java.

frontMatter.title: Use the Mapbox Vision SDK for Android with an external USB camera
frontMatter.description: Implement a custom VideoSource that feeds video stream from the USB camera to the Mapbox Vision SDK for Android.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with the Vision SDK, Android Studio, and Kotlin or Java.

frontMatter.title: Data-joins with Mapbox Boundaries
frontMatter.description: Join data with v2 of the Mapbox Boundaries tileset.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development and access to Mapbox Boundaries.

frontMatter.title: Find elevations with the Tilequery API
frontMatter.description: Use the Mapbox Tilequery API and the Mapbox Terrain tileset to create an app that returns the elevation at a specified coordinate.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Get started with the Isochrone API
frontMatter.description: Create a web app using the Mapbox Isochrone API that allows users to visualize how far they could walk, bike, or drive within a given amount of time.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Using geofences for location-based notifications and events
frontMatter.description: Create isochrones with the Mapbox Isochrone and Mapbox Tiling Service, and perform geofencing with the Mapbox Tilequery API.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts including JavaScript and API calls.

frontMatter.title: Getting started with the Mapbox Directions API
frontMatter.description: Add routing capabilities to your application with the Mapbox Directions API.

frontMatter.title: Build a navigation app for iOS
frontMatter.description: Integrate navigation into any iOS application.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Xcode, Swift, and CocoaPods or Carthage.

frontMatter.title: Local search with the Geocoding API
frontMatter.description: This tutorial guides you through the process of creating a local search app using optional parameters from the Mapbox Geocoding API.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Work with markers in Mapbox.js
frontMatter.description: Add custom, interactive markers to your map with Mapbox.js.

frontMatter.title: Show changes over time with Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Build a map application with Mapbox GL JS to visualize changes in data over time.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts. Some advanced JavaScript required.

frontMatter.title: Generate an optimized route with the Optimization API
frontMatter.description: Use the Mapbox Optimization API to generate a duration-optimized route between several points.
frontMatter.prereq: Advanced JavaScript required.

frontMatter.title: Use Mapbox GL JS in a React app
frontMatter.description: Create a React web app that uses Mapbox GL JS to render a map.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with React and front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Processing satellite imagery
frontMatter.description: Learn how to find satellite raster data, process it using the Rasterio command-line tool, and publish it on a webpage.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts. Some advanced JavaScript required.

frontMatter.title: Create interactive hover effects with Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Use feature state and expressions with Mapbox GL JS to dynamically style individual features in a map that shows earthquakes from the past week.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Get started with the Map Matching API
frontMatter.description: Create a web app that uses the Mapbox Map Matching API to allow users to specify their own driving route.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Route avoidance with the Directions API and Turf.js
frontMatter.description: Learn how to build route avoidance into your navigation app using the Mapbox Directions API, Turf.js, and Mapbox GL JS.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Make a healthy food finder with the Tilequery API
frontMatter.description: Create a web app that uses the Mapbox Tilequery API in concert with the Mapbox Geocoding API to show all stores that sell food that are located within one mile of a query point.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts.

frontMatter.title: Draw points of interest using the Mapbox Vision SDK for Android
frontMatter.description: Use coordinate transformations to draw a point of interest (POI) on the screen from its geolocation using the Vision SDK for Android.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with Android Studio and Kotlin or Java. Completion of the Mapbox Vision SDK for Android `Install and configure` guide.

frontMatter.title: Build a store locator using Mapbox GL JS
frontMatter.description: Build a map application with Mapbox GL JS. This guide walks you through all the code that you need to build a store locator.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts. Some advanced JavaScript required.

frontMatter.title: Sort stores by distance
frontMatter.description: This guide walks you through all the code that you need to build a store locator which lets you search for the nearest location.
frontMatter.prereq: Familiarity with front-end development concepts. Some advanced JavaScript required.

frontMatter.title: Attribution
frontMatter.description: Learn when, why, and how you are required to add attribution to applications built with Mapbox.
